column3: Kyushu (southernmost of the four main islands of Japan)
a long time (since the last time)
samadhi (state of intense concentration achieved through meditation)
to give (esp. to someone of lower status)
water (esp. cool, fresh water, e.g. drinking water)
Shikoku (smallest of the four main islands of Japan)
Democratic Party (esp. DPJ or US Democratic Party)
dashi (Japanese soup stock made from fish and kelp)
to be able (in a position) to do
end (e.g. of a roll of film)
eighth sign of the Chinese zodiac (The Ram, 1pm-3pm, south-southwest, June)
yukata (light cotton kimono worn in the summer or used as a bathrobe)
drawing up (e.g. legal document, contract, will, etc.)
being in charge (of an area of responsibility)
to entrust (e.g. a task) to another
position in a game of go or shogi
conquest (of a difficulty, illness, handicap, etc.)
not writing or contacting for a while
prevention of damage resulting from a natural disaster
person's origin (e.g. city, country, parentage, school)
capsicum (Capsicum annuum, esp. the cultivated chili peppers)
low (rank, degree, value, content, quality, etc.)
legume (esp. edible legumes or their seeds, such as beans, peas, pulses, etc.)

region south of Tokyo on Pacific Ocean side of Japan

counter for nights of a stay
that (indicating something distant from both speaker and listener (in space, time or psychologically), or something understood without naming it directly)

activity (of a person, organization, animal, volcano, etc.)

to get on (train, plane, bus, ship, etc.)

something that leaps or thrusts out
moving to a different location to start a new job
going to the hospital for regular treatment
in the end (after a long process)

daikon (variety of large white Oriental radish, Raphanus sativus var. longipinnatus)
looking up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
payment made via bank deposit transfer
illness (usu. excluding minor ailments, e.g. colds)
(a) stop (e.g. in a timber joint, or at the end of a kanji stroke)

pluralizing suffix (esp. for people and animals; formerly honorific)
to wear (in modern Japanese, from the shoulders down)

agricultural chemical (i.e. pesticide, herbicide, fungicide, etc.)
threshold (esp. one with grooves for sliding doors)

link (e.g. in a chain of events)
